author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
A heart so broken, modern healers say,
In more than jest, such pain does truly lay.
From times long past, a truth we now convey,
Pain of heart is more than mere word's play.

Inverter'd oceans, warmth increasing fast,
As Earth's roaring heart breaks free at last.
In life's liquid engine, stories vast,
Disrupted flow recalls a fading past.

A capital in slumber, division's mirth,
Rebels clad in elephantine girth.
Fueled by words, their power they birth,
Blocking deals, they render joy to dearth.

feedItems.title: Broken Hearts and How to Heal Them
feedItems.description: Modern medicine confirms what people have known for thousands of years: heartbreak is more than a metaphor.

feedItems.title: The Shifting Flows of Our Overheated Oceans
feedItems.description: The Earth’s waters are the dynamic, liquid engine of life across the planet, and rising temperatures are disrupting its workings in a multitude of ways

feedItems.title: How Polarization Sent Washington Hurtling Into a Shutdown
feedItems.description: GOP rebels, fueled by social media and online fundraising, feel empowered to block their leaders from cutting deals with Democrats.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the halls where stories doth flow like mead,
A change is nigh, the Skald's craft may recede.
On tempest-tossed seas of script and screen, 
The golden age of tales, no longer seen.

To east, in Poland, known as J-Town's stead,
Stout warriors move arms, their duty bred.
'Gainst lurking spies, their cause they staunchly defend,
In this grim dance of war, none can pretend.

Yet, in the market, a gentle summer's sigh,
Of wavering heat, as inflation doth lie.
The price pressure ebbs, like tide at its fall,
As August marks a cooling, welcomed by all.

feedItems.title: Peak TV Is Over. A Different Hollywood Is Coming.
feedItems.description: The end of the writers’ strike marks a new era. Studios and streamers are likely to order fewer TV shows. Consolidation could follow.

feedItems.title: In Poland's 'J-Town,' Soldiers Move Arms to Ukraine as Russian Spies Try to Stop Them
feedItems.description: A major logistics hub for the war is humming despite espionage and a diplomatic dispute between Warsaw and Kyiv.

feedItems.title: Underlying inflation cooled notably this summer, with price pressures moderating for a third consecutive month in August.
feedItems.description: Underlying inflation cooled notably this summer, with price pressures moderating for a third consecutive month in August.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the halls of power a harrowed dance,
An IRS rogue gave not a fair chance,
Stolen the gold script of Trump and peers,
Leaked unto quires stirring up fears.

An unholy toll in West Pakistan's tide,
In a procession of faith, fifty-one died.
A bomber, on himself inflicting due,
In the midst of prayer, calamity grew.

In Wall Street's realm, a reckoning day,
SEC's hand weighs heavy in the fray,
Fines like a tempest, drenching the wicked,
In their fiscal year end, the gavel hath clicked.

feedItems.title: Federal prosecutors charged an IRS contractor with stealing the tax returns of Trump and thousands of other wealthy Americans and leaking them to news organizations.
feedItems.description: Federal prosecutors charged an IRS contractor with stealing the tax returns of Trump and thousands of other wealthy Americans and leaking them to news organizations.

feedItems.title: A suicide bomber blew himself up in the midst of a religious procession in western Pakistan, killing at least 51 people.
feedItems.description: A suicide bomber blew himself up in the midst of a religious procession in western Pakistan, killing at least 51 people.

feedItems.title: The SEC closed out its fiscal year with a surge of civil-enforcement actions, as Wall Street's top regulator brought in $218 million in fines on Friday.
feedItems.description: The SEC closed out its fiscal year with a surge of civil-enforcement actions, as Wall Street’s top regulator brought in $218 million in fines on Friday.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In Ford and GM, the workers make a stand,
Their voice echoing over the bargaining land.
As a flagon emptied, progress doth lack,
O UAW, when will thee union strike back?

The S&P hath fallen, in this year the worst,
Like an alehouse empty, investors are cursed.
As Dow bemoans loss, yet Nasdaq doth gain,
Are we drunk on illusion, or sobered by pain?

Apple now face opposition in China's grand court,
For their wealth of foreign apps is under report.
Just as monks lust for wine from other realms,
Tech giant's desires, these rules overwhelm.

feedItems.title: UAW extended its strike to a Ford factory in Chicago and a GM plant in Michigan, citing a lack of progress at the bargaining table.
feedItems.description: UAW extended its strike to a Ford factory in Chicago and a GM plant in Michigan, citing a lack of progress at the bargaining table.

feedItems.title: The S&P 500 fell Friday, locking in its worst month so far this year. The benchmark index slipped 0.3%, while the Dow lost 0.5% and the Nasdaq added 0.1%.
feedItems.description: The S&P 500 fell Friday, locking in its worst month so far this year. The benchmark index slipped 0.3%, while the Dow lost 0.5% and the Nasdaq added 0.1%.

feedItems.title: Apple staff met with Chinese officials in recent months to discuss concerns over new rules that will restrict the tech giant from offering many foreign apps currently available on its iPhone app store in China.
feedItems.description: Apple staff met with Chinese officials in recent months to discuss concerns over new rules that will restrict the tech giant from offering many foreign apps currently available on its iPhone app store in China.
